entries.name: ARP Redshift Law (derived mapping)
entries.description: A redshift-like relaxation emerges when an ARP-governed transport variable is mapped to a normalized deficit observable.
entries.derivation: Assume post-event ARP relaxation: G(t)=G_{\infty}+(G(0)-G_{\infty})e^{-\mu t}. Define z(t):=z_0\left(1-\frac{G(t)-G_{\infty}}{G(0)-G_{\infty}}\right) \Rightarrow z(t)=z_0(1-e^{-\mu t}), so \gamma\equiv\mu.
assumptions: Single-timescale exponential relaxation dominates over the interval (constant \mu).
z(t) is defined as a monotone normalized deficit of a relaxing transport/coherence variable.
A stable asymptote G_{\infty} (equivalently z_0) exists over the measurement window.

entries.name: ARP Lyapunov Stability Form
entries.description: Candidate stability proof template for adaptive conductance dynamics.
entries.equationLatex: V(x)\ge 0,\ V(0)=0;\ \dot V(x)=\nabla V\cdot \dot x\le -\alpha V(x)

entries.name: Temperature-Dependent Conductance Law
entries.description: Extends ARP equilibrium with an exponential temperature factor for material sensitivity.

entries.name: Unified Dynamic Constants Law
entries.description: First-order linear coupling for adaptive updates of πₐ, e, ϕ, and c, expressing networked rates of change—models the unification of ARP, AIN, and πₐ system parameters.

entries.name: Curve Memory Fine-Structure Emergence
entries.description: Formalizes the emergence of the inverse fine-structure constant (α⁻¹ ≈ 137) via resonant harmonic conditions in curve memory, assuming an equilibrium state governed by ARP-influenced boundary dynamics.

entries.name: Shielding Mechanism Law (ARP)
entries.description: Proposes a shielding effect in ARP systems, modeled as a fractional reduction of the external field. The effective field is E_eff = (1 − λ)E_ext, while the induced adaptive current follows J_adapt = σE_ext, with 0 < λ < 1.

entries.name: Redshift-ARP Superconductivity Law
entries.description: Proposes a cosmological scaling for critical superconducting resistance: R_s(z) = R_{s,0} (1+z)^alpha. Assumes layered structure, universal conductance constant, ARP regime dominant.

entries.name: Phase-Lifted Complex Conductance Update
entries.description: Complex-admittance lift of ARP: conductance grows along the instantaneous current phasor direction using a Phase-Lifted (unwrapped) phase. Assumes phase-coherent transport where a complex ~G is meaningful. Optional variant: include a Z2 parity factor b_ij = (-1)^{w_ij} multiplying e^{iθ_R,ij} to model sign flips under branch crossings.

entries.name: Phase-Coupled Stability Threshold Law
entries.description: Adds a phase-coupled suppression term to ARP: conductance growth is damped by lifted phase accumulation relative to the local period 2πₐ. Predicts a sharp stability/transition-like behavior when θ_R approaches half-integer multiples of πₐ (maximal sin²). Assumptions: θ_R,ij is a Phase-Lifted (unwrapped) phase-like observable for edge current; πₐ sets the relevant phase period; λ has units 1/time.

entries.name: Phase Energy Functional
entries.description: Quadratic phase-smoothing energy over edges: penalizes phase differences with weights w_{ij}; useful as a regularizer or Lyapunov-like candidate in phase-coupled dynamics.
assumptions: w_{ij} carry the energy units and encode coupling/penalty strength.
Δφ_{ij} is a phase difference (dimensionless or radians).

entries.name: Adaptive Branch Impedance (AIN)
entries.description: Time-varying RLC impedance expressed via adaptive conductance G_{ij}(t) and adaptive inductance/capacitance, extending ARP/AIN to frequency-domain response.
assumptions: G, L, C are functions of time (slowly varying relative to the carrier ω).
Standard linear RLC phasor conventions apply.
